com.att.aro.videocapture

Class DataAtomOutputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.OutputStream
      • java.io.FilterOutputStream
        • com.att.aro.videocapture.DataAtomOutputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class DataAtomOutputStream
extends java.io.FilterOutputStream
    Represents an output stream filter that supports the common data types used inside of QuickTime Data Atoms.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected static long MAC_TIMESTAMP_EPOCH
      The Mac Epoch format timestamp value.
      protected long written
      The current number of bytes written to the data output stream.

      • Fields inherited from class java.io.FilterOutputStream

        out

      DataAtomOutputStream(java.io.OutputStream out)
      Initializes a new instance of the DataAtomOutputStream class using the specified OutputStream object.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void incCount(int value)
      Increases the written counter by the specified value until it reaches Long.MAX_VALUE.
      long size()
      Returns the current value of the counter written, the number of bytes written to this data output stream so far.
      void write(byte[] b, int off, int len)
      Writes the specified number of bytes from a byte array to the underlying output stream, starting at the specified offset.
      void write(int b)
      Writes the specified byte (the low eight bits of the int parameter b) to the underlying output stream.
      void writeBCD2(int v)
      Writes a BCD2 to the underlying output stream.
      void writeBCD4(int v)
      Writes a BCD4 to the underlying output stream.
      void writeByte(int v)
      Writes a byte to the underlying output stream as a 1 byte value.
      void writeFixed16D16(double f)
      Writes a 32-bit fixed-point number divided as a 16 bit number with a 16 bit decimal value (16.16).
      void writeFixed2D30(double f)
      Writes a 32-bit fixed-point number divided as a 2 bit number with a 30 bit decimal value (2.30).
      void writeFixed8D8(float f)
      Writes a 16-bit fixed-point number divided as an 8 bit number with an 8 bit decimal value (8.8).
      void writeInt(int v)
      Writes an int value to the underlying output stream as four bytes.
      void writeLong(long v)
      Writes a long value to the output stream.
      void writeMacTimestamp(java.util.Date date)
      Writes a 32-bit Mac format timestamp (the number of seconds since 1902), to the output stream.
      void writePString(java.lang.String s)
      Writes a Pascal String to the underlying output stream.
      void writePString(java.lang.String s, int length)
      Writes a Pascal String, padded to the specified fixed size in bytes, to the output stream.
      void writeShort(int v)
      Writes a signed 16-bit integer value to the output stream.

      Writes a 4 byte Atom Type identifier to the output stream.

      Writes an unsigned 32 bit integer value to the output stream.

      Writes an unsigned short value to the output stream.

    • Field Detail

      • MAC_TIMESTAMP_EPOCH

        protected static final long MAC_TIMESTAMP_EPOCH
        The Mac Epoch format timestamp value.

      • written

        protected long written
        The current number of bytes written to the data output stream. If this counter overflows, it will be wrapped to Integer.MAX_VALUE.

      • DataAtomOutputStream

        public DataAtomOutputStream(java.io.OutputStream out)
        Initializes a new instance of the DataAtomOutputStream class using the specified OutputStream object.
        Parameters:
        out - The OutputStream object that is used to create the new DataAtomOutputStream.

    • Method Detail

      • writeType

        public void writeType(java.lang.String s)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Writes a 4 byte Atom Type identifier to the output stream.
        Parameters:
        s - The Atom Type identifier to be written. A string with a length of 4 characters.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • writeByte

        public final void writeByte(int v)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Writes a byte to the underlying output stream as a 1 byte value. If no exception is thrown, the byte counter is incremented by 1.
        Parameters:
        v - The byte value to be written.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
        See Also:
        FilterOutputStream.out

      • write

        public void write(byte[] b,
         int off,
         int len)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the specified number of bytes from a byte array to the underlying output stream, starting at the specified offset. If no exception is thrown, the number of bytes written (the byte counter) is incremented by the value of the len parameter.
        Overrides:
        write in class java.io.FilterOutputStream
        Parameters:
        b - The array of bytes to write to the output stream.
        off - The offset in the array to begin writing from.
        len - The number of bytes to write from the array.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
        See Also:
        FilterOutputStream.out

      • write

        public void write(int b)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the specified byte (the low eight bits of the int parameter b) to the underlying output stream. If no exception is thrown, the byte counter is incremented by 1.This method implements the write method of the underlying OutputStream class.
        Overrides:
        write in class java.io.FilterOutputStream
        Parameters:
        b - The byte to be written.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        See Also:
        FilterOutputStream.out

      • writeInt

        public void writeInt(int v)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Writes an int value to the underlying output stream as four bytes. The high byte is written first. If no exception is thrown, the byte counter is incremented by 4.
        Parameters:
        v - The int value to be written.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
        See Also:
        FilterOutputStream.out

      • size

        public final long size()
        Returns the current value of the counter written, the number of bytes written to this data output stream so far. If the counter overflows, it will be wrapped to Integer.MAX_VALUE.
